ticket.title: Remove fixtures from tests when --skip-activerecord is used
ticket.original-body: Since fixtures use built with ActiveRecord, I modified the rails app generator to only include it if ActiveRecord is being used as the ORM. If --skip-activerecord is used, then the test/fixtures directory is removed and the test_helper.rb file no longer has "fixtures :all" and comments added.
ticket.latest-body: Since fixtures use built with ActiveRecord, I modified the rails app generator to only include it if ActiveRecord is being used as the ORM. If --skip-activerecord is used, then the test/fixtures directory is removed and the test_helper.rb file no longer has "fixtures :all" and comments added.
ticket.original-body-html: Since fixtures use built with ActiveRecord, I modified the rails app generator to only include it if ActiveRecord is being used as the ORM. If --skip-activerecord is used, then the test/fixtures directory is removed and the test_helper.rb file no longer has "fixtures :all" and comments added.

version.body: Since fixtures use built with ActiveRecord, I modified the rails app generator to only include it if ActiveRecord is being used as the ORM. If --skip-activerecord is used, then the test/fixtures directory is removed and the test_helper.rb file no longer has "fixtures :all" and comments added.
version.body-html: Since fixtures use built with ActiveRecord, I modified the rails app generator to only include it if ActiveRecord is being used as the ORM. If --skip-activerecord is used, then the test/fixtures directory is removed and the test_helper.rb file no longer has "fixtures :all" and comments added.
version.title: Remove fixtures from tests when --skip-activerecord is used

version.body:
Hello Peter,
I tried applying this, but got the following errors:
macbook$ git apply no_ar_no_fixtures.diff error: railties/lib/generators/rails/app/app_generator.rb: No such file or directory error: railties/lib/generators/rails/app/templates/test/test_helper.rb: No such file or directory error: patch failed: railties/test/generators/app_generator_test.rb:98 error: railties/test/generators/app_generator_test.rb: patch does not apply
Can you provide a new patch for this? I was trying to apply this against 2.3.8.
thanks Mike Riley
version.body-html:
Hello Peter,

I tried applying this, but got the following errors:

macbook$ git apply no_ar_no_fixtures.diff
error: railties/lib/generators/rails/app/app_generator.rb: No such file or directory
error: railties/lib/generators/rails/app/templates/test/test_helper.rb: No such file or directory
error: patch failed: railties/test/generators/app_generator_test.rb:98
error: railties/test/generators/app_generator_test.rb: patch does not apply

Can you provide a new patch for this? I was trying to apply this against 2.3.8.

thanks
Mike Riley
version.title: Remove fixtures from tests when --skip-activerecord is used

version.body:
I get the same errors while trying to apply to 3-0-stable.
@@@
Applying: Generating rails app without activerecord will no longer use fixtures in tests. error: railties/lib/generators/rails/app/app_generator.rb: does not exist in index error: railties/lib/generators/rails/app/templates/test/test_helper.rb: does not exist in index error: patch failed: railties/test/generators/app_generator_test.rb:98 error: railties/test/generators/app_generator_test.rb: patch does not apply Patch failed at 0001 Generating rails app without activerecord will no longer use fixtures in tests. @@@
Peter can you fix that patch? Or can somebody else volunteer to do it? :)
version.body-html:
I get the same errors while trying to apply to 3-0-stable.

Patch failed at 0001 Generating rails app without activerecord will no longer use fixtures in tests.

Peter can you fix that patch? Or can somebody else volunteer to do it? :)
version.title: Remove fixtures from tests when --skip-activerecord is used

version.body: i dont mind making the patch now but would be ashamed of getting credit. Can the credit still be given to Peter at commit? :)
version.body-html: i dont mind making the patch now but would be ashamed of getting credit. Can the credit still be given to Peter at commit? :)
version.title: Remove fixtures from tests when --skip-activerecord is used

version.body:
Not sure this is relevant anymore.
Having a quick look, it seems the only thing this patch adds (that is not already there) is skipping the creation of an empty fixtures directory.
The -skip-activerecord already skips writing of the "fixtures :all" in the test_helper.rb (the condition is already there in the app template).
We could still re-write the patch to not create the redundant fixtures directory. Is the empty fixtures directory just an irritant or is it actually malignant?
version.body-html:
Not sure this is relevant anymore.

Having a quick look, it seems the only thing this patch adds (that is not already there) is skipping the creation of an empty fixtures directory.

The -skip-activerecord already skips writing of the "fixtures :all" in the test_helper.rb (the condition is already there in the app template).

We could still re-write the patch to not create the redundant fixtures directory. Is the empty fixtures directory just an irritant or is it actually malignant?
version.title: Remove fixtures from tests when --skip-activerecord is used

version.body: In my opinion the fixtures directory shouldn't be created. Any body else have thoughts on this?
version.body-html: In my opinion the fixtures directory shouldn't be created. Any body else have thoughts on this?
version.title: Remove fixtures from tests when --skip-activerecord is used

version.body:
I agree. `test/fixtures` is Active Record specific and thus shouldn't be created if the user decided to skip using Active Record. If any other fixture libraries out there use the same directory, their generators can simply create it.
Peter, please recreate the patch. If you don't someone else will, and will get the credit. Consider yourself warned. :)
version.body-html:
I agree. test/fixtures is Active Record specific and thus shouldn't be created if the user decided to skip using Active Record. If any other fixture libraries out there use the same directory, their generators can simply create it.

Peter, please recreate the patch. If you don't someone else will, and will get the credit. Consider yourself warned. :)
version.title: Remove fixtures from tests when --skip-activerecord is used

version.body: Here's a rewritten patch. Please verify.
version.body-html: Here's a rewritten patch. Please verify.

+1
Applies, test passes and it works.
version.body-html:
+1

Applies, test passes and it works.

version.body: Aditya Sanghi if you consider that the commits are completely different is ok having you as the author. One thing i'm going to ask you is to merge the commits in one, you're second patch is changing your first one. Is better have this in one commit to keep trace about patches later ;). Thank you.

Aditya Sanghi if you consider that the commits are completely different is ok having you as the author. One thing i'm going to ask you is to merge the commits in one, you're second patch is changing your first one. Is better have this in one commit to keep trace about patches later ;).
Thank you.

version.title: Remove fixtures from tests when --skip-activerecord is used

version.body: It seems good but I believe test/fixtures should stay (fixtures does not only refers to AR fixtures). Also, in the final code, you are calling "empty_directory :test" while I believe it is not necessary.
version.body-html: It seems good but I believe test/fixtures should stay (fixtures does not only refers to AR fixtures). Also, in the final code, you are calling "empty_directory :test" while I believe it is not necessary.
version.title: Remove fixtures from tests when --skip-activerecord is used

version.body:
Hehe that's right. But now you can take some credit because the patch is wrong.
performance dir is not empty it has a browsing_test.rb file, so make your own patch based on the previous changes adding this dir with this file. Please add tests for that.
Thanks.
version.body-html:
Hehe that's right. But now you can take some credit because the patch is wrong.

performance dir is not empty it has a browsing_test.rb file, so make your own patch based on the previous changes adding this dir with this file. Please add tests for that.

Thanks.
version.title: Remove fixtures from tests when --skip-activerecord is used

version.body: Fine, reverting the code bits. Just fixing the test. The rest is unnecessary as it is all already working.

version.title: Remove fixtures from tests when --skip-activerecord is used

version.body: You still need to change performance dir from an empty dir to a dir with the browsing_test.rb file and add a test for this ;)
version.body-html: You still need to change performance dir from an empty dir to a dir with the browsing_test.rb file and add a test for this ;)
version.title: Remove fixtures from tests when --skip-activerecord is used

version.body:
I must be going nuts, Santiago, but i'm not able to see the obvious here.
As I investigated earlier, there were 3 main bits to Peter Bui's patch. One was fixing the test_helper.rb to not output "fixtures :all" in case skip-active-record is provided. The second was split out "directory 'test'" into a bigger code block in app_generator.rb. The third was a test case.
Now as I investigated, the first part is already in place, so no change. The second part does not need to be updated if as Jose suggested we leave the fixtures directory in the test directory, so no change here too.
The only part my patch puts in is a new test assertion that tests for non-existance of "fixtures :all" when --skip-active-record is provided.
Perhaps you are looking at an older patch of mine? Or maybe in your local area, my earlier patch removed some directories?
Feel free to point me to something i'm missing here.
version.body-html:
I must be going nuts, Santiago, but i'm not able to see the obvious here.

As I investigated earlier, there were 3 main bits to Peter Bui's patch. One was fixing the test_helper.rb to not output "fixtures :all" in case skip-active-record is provided. The second was split out "directory 'test'" into a bigger code block in app_generator.rb. The third was a test case.

Now as I investigated, the first part is already in place, so no change. The second part does not need to be updated if as Jose suggested we leave the fixtures directory in the test directory, so no change here too.

The only part my patch puts in is a new test assertion that tests for non-existance of "fixtures :all" when --skip-active-record is provided.

Perhaps you are looking at an older patch of mine? Or maybe in your local area, my earlier patch removed some directories?

Feel free to point me to something i'm missing here.
version.title: Remove fixtures from tests when --skip-activerecord is used
